section.p: To install a Metrics Agent, proceed as follows:

li.p: Log in to the Control Machine.
Open the configuration file of the Control Machine with your favorite editor.
Example:
Configure the host on which you want to install an agent. For this purpose, check the following section in the configuration file:
li.codeblock: # Monasca Agent Hosts openstack-monasca-agent ansible_ssh_host={{ openstack_host }} ansible_ssh_user={{ ssh_user_openstack }}
li.p: If required, you can add a line for installing an additional agent on a different host. The installer allows you to install one or multiple instances of an agent at a time.

When adding a line for an additional agent, you have to specify a unique alias for the host machine on which to install the agent. In addition, you have to add the agent in the [monasca_agent_group] section:
Replace the host variables with the IP address of the remote machines on which to install an agent.
li.note: supports and has been tested with IPv4. IPv6 and FQDN are not supported.
li.p: Replace <ssh_user_monasca> with the user name of the user who is to install the agent.
li.note: The user who installs the agent must have access to the machine on which the agent is to be installed. Access as a user with root privileges is required.
li.p: Check that you have removed all curly brackets with your replacements.
To establish the connection between the Control Machine and the remote machines, generate the SSH key for Ansible.
Execute the following command:
To copy the SSH key to a remote machine, execute the following command. Repeat the command for each remote machine on which to install an agent.
Replace <user_name> by the user name to be used for accessing the remote machine, and replace <host_ip_address> by the IP address of the remote machine.
Example response for a successful connection to a remote machine:
li.codeblock:
/usr/bin/ssh-copy-id: INFO: attempting to log in with the new key(s), to filter out any that are already installed /usr/bin/ssh-copy-id: INFO: 1 key(s) remain to be installed -- if you are prompted now it is to install the new keys <user_name>@<host_ip_address>'s password:
Number of key(s) added: 1
Now try logging into the machine, with: "ssh '<user_name>@<host_ip_address>'" and check to make sure that only the key(s) you wanted were added.

li.p: Create a configuration file for each agent. An individual configuration file is required for each agent instance that is to be installed.
Execute the following command to create a configuration file. Repeat the command for all host machines on which to install an agent.
Replace <file_name> with the alias for the host machine. <file_name> must be identical to the alias specified in the configuration file of the Control Machine (see Step 3 above).

Configure the agents. The following example shows the minimum set of parameters that must be configured to start an agent. The minimum set is restricted to the credentials of an OpenStack user used for the communication between the Service and the agent.
You can specify additional configuration settings, if required. For a list of the configuration settings that are supported, refer to .

To define the minimum set of parameters, insert the following content into each configuration file. Specify the user credentials of a valid OpenStack user who is authorized the send monitoring data to the Service.
Example:
li.codeblock:
# file: host_vars/horizon-monasca-agent
# Monasca Agent user credentials monasca_agent_user: admin-agent monasca_agent_password: "{{ keystone_admin_agent_password }}" monasca_agent_project: admin

ol.li:
Provide the passwords required for installing an agent. They are defined in the credentials.yml file that is located in the /opt/FJSVsvcmm directory.
Open the credentials.yml file with your favorite editor.
Example:sudo vim /opt/FJSVsvcmm/credentials.yml

li.p: Specify the following passwords in the file:
keystone_admin_agent_password for Keystone access of the user used for configuration purposes of the agents on the OpenStack hosts. The user account is automatically created with the installation.
keystone_monasca_agent_password for Keystone access of the user used for configuration purposes of the agents on the host. The user account is automatically created with the installation.
To run the installer, execute the following command:
The following response is displayed if the installation is successful.
Example:
li.codeblock: PLAY RECAP ******************************************************** monasca-agent : ok=40 changed=23 unreachable=0 failed=0
li.note: There are checks performed during installation that may result in failures or warnings. These failures and warnings are reported but they do not block the installation. It is only this final message that is relevant for a successful installation.

section.p: In case the installation fails, check your configuration settings and passwords and retry the installation in verbose mode. To collect debug information, you can execute the following command:
The agents are installed, configured, and automatically started after a successful installation. The installer creates a startup script that automatically starts the agent when the machine is booted.
A Metrics Agent is installed in a virtualenv environment. By default, the virtualenv environment of the Metrics Agent is located in the /opt/monasca-agent directory.
An agent is provided as a LINUX service.
